description: From mid- +‎ week. Compare Saterland Frisian Midwiek (“Wednesday”, literally “midweek”), German Mittwoch (“Wednesday”, literally “midweek”).

entries.meaning: That happens in the middle of the week
In the middle of the week.
examples: Leicester could only manage a goalless draw midweek with Sutton Coldfield and will be keen to return to winning form.
Peter Dods was captain in the midweek games but, like Sole, the Gala fullback has also hung up his boots.

entries.meaning: (Christianity, Latter-Day Saints, Jehovah's Witnesses, informal) Midweek worship service, held by many congregations and in addition to a Sunday morning service.
examples: This Wednesday is churchwide midweek; men's is the next one.
